intro: Scandix tinctoria, commonly known as the Indian turnsole, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and distinctive, lobed leaves. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. It grows up to 1 meter tall and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Scandix tinctoria is known for its historical use in dyeing fabrics due to the presence of certain pigments in its roots.
